section.para: A Financing Request or Trade Financing (TF) is a transaction issued in the Fusion Corporate Channels by the client and sent to a designated bank (the lender, also called Issuing Bank of the loan in the rest of this document) whereby that import or export customer requests some form of financing for an International Trade transaction.

The use of the Financing Requests module is quite generic in the sense that it aims at providing transaction handling capabilities for various types of financing such as Import Loans, Export Discounts on a presentation of documents by an exporter, as well as Trust Receipts or for instance Export Pre-Financing.

To illustrate a possible use of this module, take the example of a Trust Receipt where the customer/importer is unable to pay for the cost of goods imported according to the terms of a Documentary Collection or even a Letter of Credit, and it is necessary for him to sell the goods first.

In such a case, the Fusion Corporate Channels Financing Requests module would be used by the customer to submit his request by specifying the expected maturity date, the amount of the sale and the schedule of the goods whose possession is held by the bank under this Trust Receipt agreement.

For an Export Pre-Financing or a Packing Credit, an exporter could typically use the module to submit the request for financing and specify its maturity date, amount and typically the details of the invoices to finance.

This module enables you, on behalf of your company, to initiate new requests, send them to your chosen Issuing Bank, and subsequently follow up these transactions by sending and receiving updates on the records to and from the bank.

section.title: Terminology
section.para: Within this section of the help guide, the terms "TF" and "Financing Request" are used interchangeably. Also "LC" and "Letter of Credit" are used interchangeably. The terms "record" and "transaction" both refer to entries in the system relating to the function being discussed.

section.title: Financing Request Landing Page
section.para: The Financing Request Landing page displays a list of TFs that are in various stages of a TF life cycle. The Landing page view is customizable based on your requirement.
The following image illustrates the Financing Request landing page:

The following button enables you to initiate a new Financing Request from scratch.
Initiate Financing Request
Enter the desired terms of a new Financing Request and submit them to the Issuing Bank of your choice.

The following ribbon items enable you perform various actions on individual TFs or in bulk, based on the tab you are on. Individual tabs and related functionality are described below:
Refer section Information on Action for details on actions available on each of the listed ribbon items.
Draft
Lists all the TFs in draft state and also the transactions that checker has returned for improvement. You can Edit, View, Delete or view the history of events that Financing Request has gone through, through Details action.
Actions
Lists all the Financing Request transactions on which the bank has requested client action.
Pending Approval
Lists all existing Financing Request transactions that are awaiting client approval.
A user with batch submission permission can select multiple transactions to Approve or Return though the checkbox provided for every transactions listed in this tab.
It is mandatory to provide the comments to return a transaction.
Pending at Bank
Lists all existing Financing Request that are awaiting bank approval.
Live
Lists all the approved Financing Request records and the expired Financing Request records by the bank.
Rejected
Lists all the rejected Financing Request records by the bank. The status given to such TFs is "Not Processed".
Closed
Lists all the Financing Request transactions that have been marked as purged by the Issuing Bank's Trade Services team. You cannot initiate further amendments or messages on such a transaction, and can only use its data for inquiry purposes.

The Advance Filter presents you with various filter options like Event, Channel Reference, Bank Reference, Financing Type, Currency and Maturity Date. Enter the relevant search criterion and apply the filter to list all the relevant TFs. You can also select the time frame for which data needs to be fetched.

You can perform the following actions on the listed TFs:
Search: Enter any of the Advance Filter search criterion in the search box to display the required list of TFs
CSV Download: Download the list of TFs displayed on the dashboard. Click on the Download icon to list the formats in which the files can be downloaded. You can download Current Data or Full Data.
Current Data: Downloads the transactions displayed on screen.
Full Data: Downloads all the transactions available under a particular status tab like Draft, Rejected and more.
Column Filter: Add the column filter value to narrow down the search criterion for the listed TFs.

section.title: Licenses
section.para: Click on the Select License button and the List of licenses appears. Use Number and Currency fields to narrow down your search.

important.para: There are a few conditions that must be met for the licenses to be displayed in the popup. The following provides information for the conditions that could point to reasons that make licenses available or not available in the popup:

listitem.para: You should have created license(s) and linked it to the beneficiary selected in the Secondary Beneficiary Details section on this page. If you have selected a drawee for whom there are no licenses created, the popup will display a blank list. (This condition applies only if your administrator has selected Non-Principal Only in the License Definition. For any other selection, all licenses are available.)

Your selection of the transfer expiry date for the TF from the general details section should be within the valid to and from date of the license. Only licenses that match this criterion are displayed. If the transfer expiry date is beyond the license validity date, the list displays blank.

Your selection of multi-currency during license creation will allow you to select a currency in the Transfer Amount field that is different from the license currency and display the license in the popup. However, if multi-currency has not been selected, then the currency in the Transfer Amount field has to be the same as the license field for the license to be available in the popup.

section.para: Once you have selected a license, you have to enter a value in the Allocated Amount field that is equal to the transaction amount of the TF (refer to Amount Details section). If the amount available for the license is less than the transaction amount of the TF, you have to add and link one or more licenses to fill for the deficit.

If you have already linked a license, the details are displayed for System ID, Back Office Reference, License Number and Allocated Amount. You can choose to delete a linked license by clicking the Delete icon in the right-hand column.
